main_definition: To travel along the edge of a landmass submerged under water, or to continue without major effort or obstacles.

meanings_and_examples.example: The city is situated along the coastline.

meanings_and_examples.definition: V. - To travel or move slowly and easily, without much effort.
meanings_and_examples.example: After a long hike, we decided to take our time and coast downhill on bikes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: N. (geography) - The area along the edge of an ocean, sea, or large lake.
meanings_and_examples.example: The town is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast.

meanings_and_examples.definition: N. (idiomatic phrase) - To continue in a particular state without significant change; to persist.
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite challenges, they have continued to coast through their business with little difficulty.
